World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: The term 'demographic gap' signifies the difference
options: between the birth and the death rate
World Geography.answer: between the birth and the death rate
World Geography.explanation: Demographic gap is the difference between birth rate and death rate that develops when a country undergoes demographic transition.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Most of the communication satellites today are placed in a geostationary orbit. In order to stay over the same spot on the Earth, a geostationary satellite has to be directly above the
World Geography.explanation: A geostationary satellite is an earth-orbiting satellite. It is placed at an altitude of approximately 35,800 kilometres directly over the equator that revolves in the same direction the earth rotates (west to east).

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Wind is often found to blow in a hot summer day due to
options: conduction of heat between air and soil on the Earth
World Geography.answer: conduction of heat between air and soil on the Earth
World Geography.explanation: Wind is often found to blow in a hot summer day due to conduction of heat between air and soil on the Earth.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: What is the similarity between Milwaukee Deep, Java Trench and Challenger Deep?
options: They all are trenches in the Pacific Ocean
They are the deepest points of the Atlantic, Indian and Pacific Oceans, respectively
They all are trenches in the India Ocean
They all are deeps of the Atlantic Ocean
World Geography.answer: They are the deepest points of the Atlantic, Indian and Pacific Oceans, respectively
World Geography.explanation: They are the deepest points of the Atlantic,India and Pacific Oceanrespectively. Milwaukee Deep is the deepest part of the Atlantic Ocean. Java Trench is located in the northeastern Indian Ocean. The Challenger Deep is located in the Pacific Ocean.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Which one among the following statement is correct?
options: In summer season, the duration of day is more in Northern Hemisphere
In winter season, the duration of day is more in Northern Hemisphere
In summer season, the duration of day is less in Northern Hemisphere
In winter season, the duration of day is more in Southern Hemisphere
World Geography.answer: In summer season, the duration of day is more in Northern Hemisphere
World Geography.explanation: During summer season(May, June, and July) the northern hemisphere is exposed to more direct sunlight because the hemisphere faces the sun.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question:
Global Positioning System (GPS) is associated with
1. determining latitude and longitude
2. constellation of satellites
3. US system of GPS and Russian system of GLONASS
4. navigation
Select the correct answer using the codes given below
World Geography.explanation: The Global Positioning System (GPS) is a satellitebased system that can be used to locate positions anywhere on the earth. It is associated with longitude and latitude. It is a "constellation" of 24 well-spaced satellites that orbit the Earth and make it possible for people with ground receivers to pinpoint their geographic location. The Russian government has developed a system, similar to GPS, called GLONASS. The US began the GPS project in 1973.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: The angular speed of a whirlwind in a Tornado towards the centre
World Geography.explanation: The angular speed of a whirlwind in a Tornado towards the centre remains constant.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Currently half of the world's population live in just 6 countries. Identify them from the following
options: India, China, Pakistan, Brazil, Bangladesh, Indonesia
India, China, Bangladesh, South Africa, Pakistan, Indonesia
China, India. United States, Indonesia, Brazil, Pakistan
China, India, Bangladesh, United States, Pakistan, Indonesia
World Geography.answer: China, India. United States, Indonesia, Brazil, Pakistan
World Geography.explanation: According to data from the United Nations half of those 7.2 billion people live in only six countries: the United States, Brazil, Pakistan, India, China, and Indonesia. The world population has reached 7.2 billion.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: In the interior of the Earth
options: the temperature falls with increasing depth
the pressure falls with increasing depth
the temperature rises with increasing depth
both temperature and pressure fall with increasing depth
World Geography.answer: the temperature rises with increasing depth
World Geography.explanation: The temperature inside the earth's surface increases with depth.From 20 m below the earth's surface, the temperature increases at the rate of 1 degree Celsius for every 40 m of descent. This rapid increase of temperature continues up to a great depth.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Asia has large areas of inland drainage. Why is it so?
options: There is a number of intermontane plateaus
River channels are obstructed by lava flows
It is a very large continent
World Geography.explanation: Asia has large areas of inland drainage because rainfall is seasonal and scanty.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: The Earth revolves around the Sun in an elliptical path and the Sun is located at one focus of the ellipse. Imagine a situation in which the Earth goes around the Sun on a circular path. Which one among the following would result in under that situation?
options: It would not make and difference
Difference between seasons will be reduced
The earth would become very hot
The Earth would become very cold
World Geography.answer: Difference between seasons will be reduced
World Geography.explanation: In the given condition, difference between seasons will be reduced.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question:
Which among the following monoculture crops provide(s) immediate cash to the farmers?
1. Tea in Asom
2. Rubber in Africa
3. Sugarcane in Malaysia
4. Coffee in Brazil
World Geography.explanation: Cash crops are those which are produced for the purpose of generating cash or money. The products are therefore intended to be marketed for profit.Sugarcane and coffee are cash crops which provide immediate cash to farmers.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Why South-East Asia has the largest concentration of peasant population at the global scale?
options: The area is dominated by shifting cultivation due to favourable terrain character
Intensive subsistence farming is practised in the region
The region has favourable and healthier climate
The area has a large forested area which is cleared for cultivation of various crops
World Geography.answer: Intensive subsistence farming is practised in the region
World Geography.explanation: The term, 'intensive subsistence agriculture' is used to describe a type of agriculture characterised by high output per unit of land and relatively low output per worker. Sometimes it is also known as 'monsoon type of agriculture'. It is found in China, Japan, Korea, India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, the greater part of continental South-East Asia. This is why the largest population of peasants is found in this area.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Which one among the following best explains the reason for the Eastern and Western boundaries of the Pacific Ocean experiencing frequent earth-quake?
options: There are deep ocean trenches along these margins
High mountain stretch along the continental margins adjacent to this ocean
The currents of the vast Pacific Ocean continue to dash against the continental margins
These margins coincide with the plate margins
World Geography.answer: These margins coincide with the plate margins
World Geography.explanation: The eastern and western boundaries of the Pacific Ocean experience frequent earthquake because High mountain strech along the continental margins adjacent to this ocean.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question:
Which of the following best explain why the lower course of a river is sometimes chocked with sediments?
1. The valley of a river is widest in its lower course.
2. The velocity of a river in its lower course is low.
3. The delta sometimes develops in a river's lower course.
4. Much of the river water is drawn for irrigation in the lower course
Select the correct answer using the codes given below.
World Geography.explanation: The lower course of a river is sometimes chocked with sediments because the valley of a river is widest in its lower course, the velocity of a river in its lower course is low and the delta sometimes develops in a river's lower course.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Why do Fold Mountains have enormous thickness of sedimentary rocks?
options: Due to deposition of sediments in a valley for millions of years
Due to accumulation of sediments in a geosyncline
The plains were folded into mountains
The sediments were folded into recumbent and nappe folds
World Geography.answer: Due to accumulation of sediments in a geosyncline
World Geography.explanation: Fold Mountains form when two tectonic plates move together (a convergent plate boundary). Fold Mountains form from sedimentary rocks that accumulate along the margins of continents.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question:
Mr X has been invited to participate in a conference to be held at Buenos Aires. He has choosen the following shortest flight route
Mumbai to Frankfurt (non-stop)
Frankfurt to Sao Paulo (non-stop)
Sao Paulo to Buenos Aires (non-stop)
Which one of the following seas will likely to be flown over by Mr X ?
World Geography.explanation: Mr X will likely to be flown over Black Sea. Since Black Sea is bounded by Europe, Anatolia and Caucasus, it is ultimately connected to the Atlantic Ocean.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Match the following
List-I (Natural Vegetation of India) List-II (Annual Rainfall Received)
A. Tropical evergreen forests 1. 100-200 cm
B. Tropical deciduous forests 2. Above 200 cm
C. Tropical dry forests 3. Less than 50 cm
D. Arid forests 4. Above 300 cm
5. 50-100 cm
Indian Geography.explanation:
A. Tropical evergreen forests- Above 200 cm
B. Tropical deciduous forests - 100-200 cm
C. Tropical Dry forest- 50-100 cm
D. Arid forest- Less than 50 cm

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Match the following
List-I (Biosphere Reserve) List-II (Places)
A. Manas 1. Meghalaya
B. Pachmarhi 2. Asom
C. Nokrek 3. Madhya Pradesh
D. Achanakmar Amarkantak 4. Chhattisgarh
Indian Geography.explanation:
1. Manas- Asom
2. Pachmarhi - Madhya Pradesh
3. Nokrek - Meghalaya
4. Achanakmar-Amarkantak- Chhattisgarh,

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: The Vindhyan system of rocks is important for the production of
Indian Geography.explanation: The Vindhyan system of rocks is important for the production of precious stones and building materials. The system derives its name from the Vindhyan hills where its rocks are prominently exposed. It forms a dividing line between the Ganga Plain and the Deccan. The main rocks of the Vindhyan system are coarse, medium and fine textured sandstones, shales and limestones. The Vindhyan system of rocks bear out precious stones, ornamental stones, diamonds, building materials, and raw materials for cement, lime, glass and chemical industries

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: The rainfall distribution pattern over the Ganga basin decreases from the
options: West to East and North to South
East to West and North to South
West to East and South to North
East to West and South to North
Indian Geography.answer: East to West and North to South
Indian Geography.explanation: The rainfall distribution pattern over the Ganga basin decreases from the East to West and North to South.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Consider the following statements with regard to the mining industry of India
1. The spatial distribution of minerals is uneven.
2. The mining industry since colonial days has been export-oriented.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Consider the following statements about black soil of India
1. Black soil becomes sticky when it is wet.
2. Black soil contains adequate nitrogen as well as phosphorus required for the growth of plants.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
Indian Geography.explanation: Black soils become sticky when it is wet. It is rich in iron, lime, calcium, Magnesium, carbonates, and alumina and poor in Phosphorous, Nitrogen and Organic matter. The soil is black in colour because it is volcanic in origin. It is created from igneous rocks, and is also called 'regur soil'.
